image.altText: A rope with a flag in front of a section of lawn which has been worn away.

props.synopsis: A student encampment at the Australian National University disbands after 110 days, after the university's announcement it would no longer invest in "controversial weapons manufacturers" in the long term.

title.children: 'Completely untenable': ANU students disband pro-Palestine encampment after 110 days of protest

image.altText: A main in a white coat holds up a small specimen container while looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: Researchers at the Australian National University create a 'Trojan horse' method they believe could help in the fight against malaria and other potentially deadly parasitic diseases.

title.children: Malaria parasites love cholesterol and that could be their downfall

image.altText: Three men stand with their arms around one another, all smiling.

props.synopsis: Victor Croker and Dave Leemhuis struggled to keep their bees alive during winter so they developed a new insulated hive. It's proved so popular among beekeepers that 500 are now being shipped to the United States each week.

title.children: These beekeepers created a new type of hive that's so popular they're shipping 500 to the US each week

image.altText: black and white graphic showing old newspaper articles saying slacks banned

props.synopsis: When Dorothy Henderson-Smart based her decision to wear trousers on convenience, little did she know she'd end up making headlines. Years later, her family has uncovered the story of the "girl who shocked Canberra".

title.children: 'The girl who shocked Canberra': Dorothy Henderson-Smart and the fashion choice that sparked a national outcry

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The 27-year-old man has been jailed for a dramatic attack and robbery with two others, after the victim recognised him because they'd been to school together.

title.children: Canberra man jailed for over two years for 'cowardly' unprovoked robbery

image.altText: A composite image of two soldiers, soldiers firing a have weapon, and a brain scan

props.synopsis: Doctors suspect mysterious brain injuries in soldiers repeatedly exposed to blasts and explosions could be the cause of memory loss, headaches, fits of rage and an increased suicide risk.

title.children: How firing their own weapons has put Australia's soldiers at risk of brain injury

image.altText: Untitled design (4)

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are using tax time to spread misinformation about the Australian Taxation Office, including the claim "tax is voluntary" and the authority is "not a legal entity".

title.children: ATO warns against sovereign citizen tax misinformation, investigates 'spiritual accountant'

image.altText: Man working from home in a creative field on his ipad

props.synopsis: New laws come into effect next week that give workers the right to ignore work communications after hours, but they may not be enough to shift Australians' habit of working long hours.

title.children: In a culture of 'excessive' working, will right to disconnect laws make a difference?

props.synopsis: In Australia, there are more than twice as many children as childcare places, according to a world-first study analysing childcare access down to the street level in nine developed countries.

title.children: Australia’s childcare divide is growing. Is your neighbourhood being left behind?

image.altText: A reflection of people walking past the ASX indicator board.

props.synopsis: Two weeks ago, fear that global finance was on the eve of destruction caused a wave of panic as traders from New York to Tokyo battled one another in a race to exit financial markets. Now it's but a distant memory.

title.children: Markets are back in business after their mini-meltdown, but not everyone believes in 'the Goldilocks scenario'

image.altText: Q+A: Social media and young men

props.synopsis: A high school student says it is impossible to avoid toxic content online — and there's little transparency from social media platforms.

title.children: Young Australians can't avoid toxic content on social media, but regulation is not the answer

image.altText: An elderly couple sitting together.

props.synopsis: The federal government's star rating system for aged care facilities was supposed to provide transparency, but a former compliance officer says the ratings aren't telling the whole story about the state of aged care.

title.children: Whistle blown on 'deceptive' aged care star ratings system by former industry insider

image.altText: Joe biden seen against a black background looking serious

props.synopsis: A report by US House of Representatives Republicans alleges without evidence that the US President has enriched himself and members of his family through foreign business dealings.

title.children: Joe Biden alleged to have profited from influence-peddling scheme since 2014

image.altText: The actor Natalie Morris, a woman in her late 20s with brown/blonde wavy hair, staring seriously at the camera

props.synopsis: Beloved Australian series Bump will air its final season at the end of the year. But with screenwriting credits and a new film released, breakout star Nathalie Morris is just getting started.

title.children: Star of Bump takes on powerful new film role

image.altText: Harry and Meghan wearing sunglasses and smiling and clapping while standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: Some commentators have suggested stripping Harry and Meghan of their royal titles to avoid being seen as royal emissaries. But is the House of Montecito really such a threat?

title.children: Harry and Meghan's 'quasi-royal tour' puts King Charles in a tricky spot

image.altText: Brittany Higgins arrives at court.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins will not be called to give evidence as she defends herself against an accusation of defamation brought by Senator Linda Reynolds, her lawyer reveals.

title.children: Brittany Higgins will no longer give evidence at Linda Reynolds defamation trial

image.altText: Michael Lynch smiling and wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Mike Lynch is among six people missing after a superyacht carrying 22 people capsized and sank off the coast of Sicily due to bad weather.

title.children: 'British Bill Gates' Mike Lynch among those missing after superyacht sinks in storm off Sicily

image.altText: Black Caviar and her foal to Exceed And Excel

props.synopsis: When journalist Lucie Marr-Morris was invited to meet Black Caviar in retirement, she was shocked by the details of the champion mare's new life on a stud farm.

title.children: After an invitation to visit Black Caviar in retirement, the truth of her new life as a broodmare shocked me

image.altText: A black sign with 'CFMEU Victoria' written on it, hanging on a construction site.

props.synopsis: The CFMEU will be forced to accept an administrator, as the federal government strikes a deal with the Coalition to pass laws to take control of the troubled construction union.

title.children: CFMEU administration laws pass Senate, after government strikes deal with Coalition

image.altText: A composite of the federal opposition leader Peter Dutton (left) and the NSW opposition leader Mark Speakman

props.synopsis: NSW Liberal leader Mark Speakman says he's spoken to Peter Dutton about efficiency of the state branch after it failed to nominate close to 140 councillors in next month's elections.

title.children: Opposition leader pushes back on federal takeover of NSW Liberals after nominations 'debacle'

image.altText: A wing of plane with Rex written on the side of it

props.synopsis: Administrators for troubled airline Rex will make another 73 roles redundant from its now-defunct capital city business but say the job losses will not impact the company's flights across regional and rural Australia.

title.children: Administrators for Rex to axe another 73 jobs at troubled regional airline

image.altText: Fatima Payman in emerald green pant suit and matching hijab smiles, her husband in black pants and jacket has arm around her

props.synopsis: The inside story of why Senator Fatima Payman broke ranks with the Labor Party and the fallout that followed in the capital and at home.

title.children: When Fatima Payman derailed her Labor career, her husband was collateral damage

image.altText: Damage to the exposed wall in the room of a Philippine Coast Guard vessel

props.synopsis: The two coast guards are blaming each other for collisions near Philippine-occupied islands in the South China Sea, where China claims complete territorial sovereignty — a claim rejected by the United Nations.

title.children: Chinese and Philippine coast guard ships collide, both blame each other

image.altText: A wide shot of the Train's home, with two sheds and a dam in sight.

props.synopsis: A NSW sergeant tells the inquest they knew one of the shooters had a dislike for police before Queensland officers were sent to the property and killed in a religiously motivated attack.

title.children: Sergeant tells Wieambilla inquest he was reluctant to ask police to send officers to property before deadly ambush

image.altText: A man dressed in a suit and tie stood behind a podium

props.synopsis: Foxtel CEO Patrick Delany has initiated a number of meetings with leaders of Australia's Jewish community after a photo of him appearing to perform a Nazi salute were published on Saturday night.

title.children: Foxtel CEO apologises after photo emerges of him performing Nazi salute

image.altText: Smoke and flames rise above a residential building after a strike.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian militant group has accused the Israeli prime minister of placing obstacles in the way of achieving an agreement.

title.children: Hamas rejects Gaza ceasefire deal, blaming Netanyahu for setting new 'obstacles'

image.altText: rows of books on a shelf

props.synopsis: The administrators of online book retailer Booktopia have confirmed they have secured a buyer for the troubled business.

title.children: Booktopia commences trade again after being bought by online electronics store

image.altText: A house mid-fall into the surf.

props.synopsis: An unoccupied beach house along the Cape Hatteras National Seashore on North Carolina's Outer Banks collapsed into the water on Friday.

title.children: House collapses into sea, beaches closed as Hurricane Ernesto whips up 'life-threatening' surf conditions in US

image.altText: An old white man with a balding head speaks wearing a suit

props.synopsis: A government backbencher has spoken out against his party for gifting lobbyists more time to campaign on weaker gambling ad limits on TV and social media.

title.children: Labor slammed by own MP for giving gambling ad industry headstart on legislation

image.altText: A row of EV charging stations on a suburban road.

props.synopsis: Electric car sales are accelerating and along with it, additional demand for electricity. It's driving questions about how the grid will cope with the growing number of large batteries waiting to be charged.

title.children: Electric cars are booming as a wall of demand barrels towards the power grid. There are risks, but also opportunities

image.altText: A photo taken half underwater. A person is splashing into the blue water, while above trees and palms surround.

props.synopsis: There are fears that sacred, pristine sites are being put at risk by a government-backed push to grow cotton in the outback.

title.children: 'We're crying out for help': Pleas to save pristine outback oasis from drying up

image.altText: A woman stands outside of her home holding a printed insurance policy.

props.synopsis: More frequent extreme weather events and higher building costs are leading to record high premiums across the country, according to the insurance industry.

title.children: Katy's insurance bill has tripled, with flood risk driving a record price rise

image.altText: Felix Cameron breaks into tears as he accepts an award at the 2024 Logies

props.synopsis: Streaming platforms' new dominance over free-to-air television loomed large at the Logies as Netflix program Boy Swallows Universe nabbed a swag of awards and Gold Logie winner Larry Emdur revealed his adult children had not watched traditional TV in 15 years.

title.children: Boy Swallows Universe sweeps Logies as streaming TV becomes more popular than free-to-air

image.altText: Willie Rioli high fives Port Adelaide after a goal in an AFL semifinal against GWS Giants.

props.synopsis: The Port Adelaide Football Club has condemned racist comments on social media targeted at forward Willie Rioli after the Showdown, during which the club's mascot was allegedly assaulted.

title.children: Port Adelaide and Crows call out racial abuse directed at Willie Rioli

image.altText: Graham Wright speaking to media

props.synopsis: Collingwood football boss Graham Wright has quit his job, choosing not to return after the Magpies allowed him an overseas sabbatical.

title.children: Collingwood's football boss leaves club after taking sabbatical
